title: So at what point can we say the Akali rework was a complete and utter failure?
body:
It's been some time now and she has proven to be:

- Completely unbalanceable around true stealth

- Horribly weak because true stealth takes her entire power budget so her winrate is in the garbage can

- Yet still so completely frustrating to play against that she's also a top ban

So shes a champion that isn't fun to play against, isn't good and rewarding to play as, and cannot be balanced because she has r%%%%%ed game breaking true stealth. 

I feel like that's probably enough data to go ahead and revert and try again. Or at the very least, mini rework her true stealth and give her an actual strength that doesn't make everyone miserable while at the same time not allowing her to do well.

See, funny story about causal reasoning. Whenever something new comes, the instant reaction is to instantly ban it because nobody understands it. The more that something is banned, the less people will be able to understand it. That means when that something _isn't_ banned, people won't understand what to do about it. Meaning that something will be banned even more. Meaning whenever it's not banned, nobody will understand what to do and continue to lose against it. 

The reason she has a high win rate is because she has a high ban rate, and the reason she has a high ban rate is because she has a high win rate. That's, in a general sense, a self-fulfilling prophecy. 

Lower her ban rate and you'll probably see a drop in her win rate as well.

She's impossible to balance, annoying to play against and the fan base of that champion already doesn't like how Riot is handling it.

Nerf her shroud, and Akali fails as a champion. Nerf her execute base damage or/and scaling, now she is a viable AD/AD Crit melee champion. Nerf her healing significantly without compensation, it will make her survivability way lower and might lead to her death faster.

As OP pointed, Shroud takes too much power from her kit, reverting 8.24b nerfs and taking away the mechanic that towers can't reveal her might open up some power to other parts of her kit. If her survivability ability is so strong, her burst is shite. Which it is, (Unsurprisingly). So a good solution is to nerf her survivability in a reasonable way, lowering her damage and making her burst higher.

You...must not know how to play her, then. That, or you expect some amazing solo carry champion in a game of four other players. That's not how a champion is supposed to be balanced. From what I've seen from her players, she does just fine in most situations where good players are using her against good players. 

THAT is the only balance that matters. Not bad players against good players, not good players against bad players, not bad players against other bad players; when someone who knows how to use her plays her against players who now how to play against her. 

And in that case, she's just fine. 

So I return to my previous statement. If there is no problem, what's the problem?
